intro: Mitrephora versteegii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic pulp. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of timber. Mitrephora versteegii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is commonly found in forested areas.
